name: The Beekeeper's House
pages:
Research Notes #36

Today I found a dilapidated house in the flowering forest.

It's already bizarre enough for someone to decide to settle far from civilization, but NOT as a Predator? It seems like a miracle

that he was even able to build the structure without being assaulted by the undead, considering that there is no trace of remains of a Golem protecting him.

The owner, now conquered by the Plague, was so absorbed in his work that

he didn't even notice me; probably in life, he was so dedicated to his creatures that it stuck with him even in this state.
I wonder for how many years he has been working tirelessly to care for his bees; seeing him like this is almost pitiful.

From his diary, I assume he secluded himself away from everyone precisely because of the disease, but somehow he was infected anyway. I must take this into account for my future research.

He also seemed particularly devoted to the absent deity. I
wonder how desperate he must have been to still believe that something like that could save him.
